message.content:
Trillium luteum is a perennial herbaceous plant of the Trillium genus.
It is characterized by its yellow-green flowers and broad, leaves that are mottled with brown.
The flower petals are long and narrow, with elongated stamens and a central pistil.
The plant typically grows up to 30 cm in height and spreads up to 40 cm wide.
It prefers moist, well-drained soils, and typically blooms from April to June.
Trillium luteum is native to eastern North America, specifically in the Appalachian Mountains.
It is commonly used in traditional medicine for its astringent and tonic properties.
